title: Kandinsky in Munich, 1896-1914 (Art Ebook).pdf
description:
Guggenheim | 1982 | Pdf | Eng | 0892070307 | 312 pages | 19.7 MB

Vasily Kandinsky, it may be stated fairly, lived at least three lives in one. In the course of his seventy-eight years, despite an exceptionally late start as an artist, his work encompassed three stylistic phases which, though ultimately comprehensible as a unity, nevertheless are more than ordinarily separable from one another. Each of theseâ€”in Munich before World War I; at the Bauhaus during the postwar years; and in Paris from the rise of Nazism through World War IIâ€”represented a major episode which was more or less selfcontained. In each Kandinsky developed a style that corresponded to a particular insight, and each reflected an advanced, visionary sensibility
